item.title: Jen add a quote by Sam Levenson
item.description: "For Attractive lips, speak words of kindness. &emsp;For lovely eyes, seek out the good in people. &emsp;For a slim figure, share your food with the hungry. &emsp;For beautiful hair, let a child run their fingers through it once a day. &emsp;For poise, walk with the knowledge that you never walk alone. &emsp;People, more than things, have to be restored, renewed, revived, reclaimed, and redeemed. Remember, if you ever need a helping hand, you will find one at the end of each of your arms. &emsp;As you grow older, you will discover that you have two hands, one for helping yourself and the other for helping others." -- Sam Levenson

item.title: Jen add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Jen add a quote by Anne Frank
item.description: "How wonderful it is that nobody need wait a single moment before starting to improve the world." -- Anne Frank

item.title: Jen add a quote by Robert Bloch
item.description: "Despite my ghoulish reputation, I really have the heart of a small boy. I keep it in a jar on my desk." -- Robert Bloch

item.title: Jen add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Good books don't give up all their secrets at once." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jen add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: Jen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Lord Polonius: What do you read, my lord? Hamlet: Words, words, words. Lord Polonius: What is the matter, my lord? Hamlet: Between who? Lord Polonius: I mean, the matter that you read, my lord." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jen add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "When he shall die, Take him and cut him out in little stars, And he will make the face of heaven so fine That all the world will be in love with night And pay no worship to the garish sun." -- William Shakespeare
